availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p: The State of Massachusetts. Suffolk County. SS

I, Samuel S. Curtis, duly appointed by the Governor of the State of Kentucky, a Commissioner of the State of Kentucky, resident at Boston, in the State of Massachusetts, do solemnly swear that I will well and faithfully execute and perform all the duties of such Commissioner, under and by virtue of the laws of the state of Kentucky. So help me God.

figure.ab:
SAMUEL S. CURTIS.
COMMISSIONER
OF
Kentucky
BOSTON, MASS

body.p: Subscribed and sworn to this twenty first day of June AD 1860 before me. --

Chas. F. Adams
Justice of the Peace

Massachusetts
Comr. of Deeds
S. S. Curtis
Oath
Filed Feby 5. 1861
